title: See tractor-trailer plunge off bridge into icy river
description: A driver miraculously survived after a tractor-trailer crashed into the Charles River in Massachusetts. State police are investigating the cause of the crash.

title: Record-breaking floods hit eastern Australia
description: Eastern Australia has been hit by severe rainfall and deadly flash floods, prompting Prime Minister Scott Morrison to call the conditions a "weather bomb".

title: 'A complete waste of life': CNN reporter on bodies left after battle
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports from the graphic aftermath of a battle at a bridge outside Kyiv, Ukraine, as the Russian invasion continues into the country.

title: The questions that always enter my mind as a Black traveler
description: For many Black travelers, preparing to visit a destination isn't just a matter of booking tickets, buying foreign currency or packing a swimsuit. Often it involves mentally preparing to be confronted by something barely mentioned in guidebooks.

title: What is SWIFT and how is it being used against Russia?
description: The West has pledged to remove some Russian banks from SWIFT, a messaging service that connects financial institutions around the world, as part of a barrage of sanctions designed to limit Moscow's ability to pay for its war in Ukraine.

title: Sanctions: Russia's ruble crashes as its banking system reels
description: Russia's currency crashed to a record low against the US dollar Monday as the country's financial system reeled from crushing sanctions imposed by Western countries in response to the invasion of Ukraine.

title: How Zelensky changed the West's response to Russia
description: Five days into Russia's brutal invasion of Ukraine, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and his courageous nation have already done more to transform the West's policy toward Russia than 30 years of post-Cold War summits, policy resets and showdowns with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Paris Fashion Week women's ready-to-wear Fall-Winter 2022: How to watch the shows online
description: This week, Fashion Week continues in Paris with the next round of women's ready-to-wear shows for the Fall-Winter 2022 season. Promising in-person runways from 45 houses, brands on the official schedule include Dior, Isabel Marant, Balmain, Chanel, Chloe, Balenciaga and Loewe.

title: Russia ramps up war efforts in Ukraine as delegates arrive for talks at Belarus border
description: A miles-long convoy of Russian military vehicles is bearing down on the Ukrainian capital, new satellite imagery shows, as Moscow continues to ramp up its assault on Kyiv despite preparing for negotiations with Ukrainian representatives.

title: Many Americans still paying high costs months after insurers were ordered to cover HIV preventive care
description: Anthony Cantu, 31, counsels patients at a San Antonio health clinic about a daily pill shown to prevent HIV infection. Last summer, he started taking the medication himself, an approach called preexposure prophylaxis, better known as PrEP. The regimen requires laboratory tests every three months to ensure the powerful drug does not harm his kidneys and that he remains HIV-free.

title: 'Delay means death': We're running out of ways to adapt to the climate crisis, new report shows. Here are the key takeaways
description: Climate change is on course to transform life on Earth as we know it, and unless global warming is dramatically slowed, billions of people and other species will reach points where they can no longer adapt to the new normal, according to a major report published Monday.

title: The nightmare that haunts me and other Asian American women
description: It could have been me.  It could have been any of us.

title: First January 6 trial set to start, with high stakes for scores of other defendants
description: The sweeping January 6 investigation is headed into a new phase, with the first trial set to begin on Monday.

title: As Russian planes face airspace bans, Canada investigates reported Aeroflot violation
description: As a growing number of countries move to ban Russian flights from their airspace due to the ongoing invasion in Ukraine, officials in Canada say they are planning to launch an investigation into an Aeroflot flight from Miami to Moscow that entered Canadian airspace Sunday.

title: Miguel Angel Jimenez hits two hole-in-ones in same tournament
description: Talk about acing it.

title: FIFA plan for Russian team to play international soccer matches has been branded 'disgraceful'
description: The president of the Polish Football Association has described FIFA's plan to allow a Russian team to continue playing international soccer matches as "disgraceful."

title: Bottega Veneta unveils first collection by new creative director Matthieu Blazy
description: The 'new' vision for Bottega Veneta began with a white tank top and a pair of jeans -- the first look to open the Italian label's Fall-Winter 2022 collection in one of Milan Fashion Week's most-anticipated shows.

title: SAG Awards 2022: Best fashion on the silver carpet
description: Celebrities including Lady Gaga, "Squid Game" star Jung Ho-yeon, and Jared Leto arrived on the silver carpet at the 28th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards, dressed to the nines. The show, which is being held this year at the Barker Hangar in Los Angeles, kicked off the awards season in style as actors posed in vivid jewel tones, sparkles and metallics.

title: The 80-year nuclear question scientists still can't answer
description: A major Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change report, to be released Monday, is expected to warn that humans are wrecking the planet so profoundly that we may run out of ways to survive the crisis. The report speaks of a "rapidly closing window of opportunity to secure a liveable and sustainable future for all."

title: Surreal scenes as CNN tours deserted streets in Kyiv
description: The streets in Ukraine's capital city of Kyiv look eerily empty days into Russia's invasion of Ukraine. CNN's Alex Marquardt takes a look at what the city looks like amid increasing threats from Russian troops.

title: World's largest airplane destroyed in Ukraine
description: The world's largest aircraft, the Antonov AN-225, has been destroyed during the Russian invasion of Ukraine, according to Ukrainian officials, generating alarm and sadness among the aviation world in which it occupies almost cult status.

title: In Botswana, 20,000 zebras were doing something in secret until 10 years ago
description: The chopper rose smoothly from Maun Airport and we hurtled ahead over Thamalakane River. I knew it was a 'river' only because I could see a bridge -- there was nothing about the sandy ribbon of dust to suggest it had ever been touched by water.

title: Meltdowns may be normal, but there is a way to help your kids better process their feelings
description: As Shirley Oldale tucked her 3-year-old son into bed, he said, "I am sad because I wanted to play, and I don't want to go to bed."

title: China's reaction to Ukraine could be putting its citizens in danger
description: Chinese citizens in Ukraine find themselves in a tense situation as plans for an evacuation from the war-torn country -- set in motion weeks after Western nations urged their citizens to leave -- have stalled, leaving those who remain concerned about potential backlash over China's reaction to the Russian invasion.

title: Chelsea goalkeeper misses decisive penalty as Liverpool wins Carabao Cup after shootout drama
description: Liverpool won the Carabao Cup after narrowly edging a dramatic penalty shootout.

title: Why the US isn't sending troops into Ukraine
description: Russia's unprovoked assault on Ukraine, now in its fourth day, has faced universal condemnation from Western powers.

title: Armani pays tribute to Ukraine suffering with silent show
description: Giorgio Armani switched off the music to hold his Milan fashion show in silence on Sunday out of respect for the people caught in the Ukrainian conflict.

title: In pictures: Protests across the world show support for Ukraine
description: As the Russian invasion of Ukraine continues to shock the world, people all over the planet are watching in horror and disbelief.

title: Shock and disbelief brings odd silence as women and children seek refuge
description: CNN's Arwa Damon is in Poland talking to people who spent days traveling in the bitter cold after leaving their entire lives behind in Ukraine.

title: See the videos people are falsely claiming show war in Ukraine
description: Videos on social media and TV falsely claim to show scenes from the war in Ukraine, and they're getting millions of views.

title: Is the Ukraine-Russia meeting a path forward or political sideshow?
description: The stage is set for a meeting between Russia and Ukraine Monday on the Ukrainian-Belarusian border, near the Pripyat River.

title: Social media videos show fighting in streets of Kharkiv
description: Fierce resistance by Ukrainian forces and armed civilians has thwarted at least one attempt by Russian troops to advance into Kharkiv, Ukraine's second largest city. CNN's Alex Marquardt has more.

title: White House responds to Russia's decision to put deterrence forces on high alert
How an Indian company is transforming palm leaves into tableware
description: It's time for lunch in the southern Indian city of Hyderabad and locals are crowding at Prahalad Tiffin Point, a popular roadside eatery serving regional staples like dosa and idli.

title: Ukrainian soldier: Russians said they wouldn't hit civilian infrastructure. Look around
description: The sleepy Ukrainian port town of Mykolaiv has fought off the advancement of Russian troops, but locals fear they may be overrun. CNN's Nick Paton Walsh reports.

title: Here's why Russia's invasion of Ukraine is being called the 'TikTok war'
description: Ukrainian Instagram influencers are now warzone witnesses and urban warfare experts are tweeting tips to Ukrainian fighters, CNN's chief media correspondent Brian Stelter said on "Reliable Sources" Sunday. But the onslaught of words and images is fueling a confusing media environment where disinformation is rampant.

title: 'Sign of weakness': Ex-CIA director on Putin's move
description: Former CIA director Leon Panetta reacts after Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered his country's deterrence forces -- including nuclear arms -- onto their highest state of alert.
